movesets.name: Bulk Up

items.name: Leftovers
items.description: Heals 1/16 of max HP each turn.

movesets.description:
Moves

Circle Throw is a STAB attack with a great deal of utility thanks to its phazing effect; it punishes opponents trying to set up at the same time as Throh as well as checks and counters trying to switch in. Knock Off has great neutral coverage alongside Circle Throw. It most notably hits Ghost- and Psychic-types for super effective damage, and depriving the foe of its held item is always useful. However, running Knock Off means that Throh has to forego Sleep Talk, in turn forcing it to forego Leftovers in favor of Chesto Berry. Additionally, foregoing Sleep Talk means that Throh is a sitting duck for two turns unless you have cleric support. Sleep Talk lets Throh function whilst asleep, though running it instead of Knock Off makes Throh completely useless against Ghost-types. Bulk Up provides an increase to Throh's Attack and Defense, allowing it to pose as more of an offensive threat whilst increasing its physical bulk. Rest is Throh's sole means of recovery. When equipped with a Chesto Berry, Throh will be able to wake up immediately after its first use of Rest.

Set Details

Guts is the ability of choice on this set because it increases Throh's Attack when afflicted with status. Leftovers grants Throh much-appreciated passive recovery, whereas Chesto Berry guarantees that Throh will wake up immediately after having regained health with Rest. Chesto Berry should only be used if Throh is running Knock Off.

Usage Tips

Throh can be brought in on a Pokemon that it scares out and proceed to set up. Weaker physical attackers can be rendered setup bait for Throh. If it is running Sleep Talk rather than Knock Off, Throh should not be setting up if there is a Ghost-type on the opponent's team. Use common sense to judge when to use Rest, as Throh will either have to stay in for two turns while being reliant on Sleep Talk, or switch out to let a cleric wake it up (The latter only applies to Chesto Berry variants after their Chesto Berry has been consumed.) Being badly poisoned or burned isn't favorable for Throh in the long run, so Throh may want to use Rest some point soon after having been afflicted with one of those statuses. Once Throh has accumulated some boosts, Circle Throw is the best thing to use in most scenarios. Circle Throw's phazing effect is especially useful when an opponent tries to set up or brings in a non-Ghost-type check. Use Knock Off if you predict a Ghost- or Psychic-type switch-in.

Team Options

Throh likes having teammates that can set up hazards, such as Garbodor and Ferroseed, because it is going to be doing a lot of phazing. The latter makes for a particularly good choice as it resists Fairy and Psychic while Throh resists Knock Off, which cripples Ferroseed. Cleric and Wish support works wonderfully with a set such as this; Throh can be awoken from its sleep after using Rest, and Wish will be able to heal Throh. Lickilicky and Audino are great examples of Pokemon capable of providing this support, as they have access to Heal Bell, can take hits well, and pass large Wishes thanks to their great HP. Pursuit trappers such as Liepard and Sneasel work well alongside Throh, as they can dispose of, or, at the very least, badly weaken Ghost- and Psychic-types.

moves.name: Attract
moves.description: Targets of the opposite gender are infatuated and have a 50% chance to do nothing.

moves.name: Bide
moves.description: Charges for 2-3 turns; returns double the damage received in those turns.

moves.name: Bind
moves.description: Prevents the opponent from attacking for 2-5 turns.

moves.name: Block
moves.description: The target cannot switch out.

moves.name: Body Slam
moves.description: 30% chance to paralyze.

moves.name: Brick Break
moves.description: Destroys Light Screen and Reflect, then hits.

moves.name: Bulk Up
moves.description: Boosts Attack and Defense by 1 stage.

moves.name: Bulldoze
moves.description: Lowers target's Speed by 1 stage.

moves.name: Circle Throw
moves.description: Forces the target to switch to a random Pokemon.

moves.name: Confide
moves.description: Lowers the target's Special Attack by 1 stage.

moves.name: Dig
moves.description: User is made invulnerable for one turn, then hits the next turn.

moves.name: Double Team
moves.description: Boosts evasion by 1 stage.

moves.name: Earthquake
moves.description: Hits Pokemon using Dig with double Base Power.

moves.name: Endure
moves.description: The user always survives with at least 1 HP.

moves.name: Facade
moves.description: Has 140 Base Power when burned, paralyzed, or poisoned.

moves.name: Fire Punch
moves.description: 10% chance to burn.

moves.name: Fling
moves.description: Throws the user's hold item at the foe. Power and effect depend on the item.

moves.name: Focus Blast
moves.description: 10% chance to lower Special Defense by 1 stage.

moves.name: Focus Energy
moves.description: Boosts critical hit rate by 1 stage.

moves.name: Frustration
moves.description: No additional effect.

moves.name: Giga Impact
moves.description: User cannot move next turn.

moves.name: Grass Knot
moves.description: Deals damage based on the foe's weight.

moves.name: Helping Hand
moves.description: Increases power of ally's moves by 50%.

moves.name: Hidden Power Bug
moves.description: Type is based on the user's IVs.

moves.name: Hidden Power Dark
moves.description: Type is based on the user's IVs.

moves.description: Type is based on the user's IVs.

moves.description: Type is based on the user's IVs.

moves.description: Type is based on the user's IVs.

moves.description: Type is based on the user's IVs.

moves.description: Type is based on the user's IVs.

moves.name: Hidden Power Ghost
moves.description: Type is based on the user's IVs.

moves.description: Type is based on the user's IVs.

moves.description: Type is based on the user's IVs.

moves.description: Type is based on the user's IVs.

moves.name: Hidden Power Poison
moves.description: Type is based on the user's IVs.

moves.name: Hidden Power Psychic
moves.description: Type is based on the user's IVs.

moves.name: Hidden Power Rock
moves.description: Type is based on the user's IVs.

moves.name: Hidden Power Steel
moves.description: Type is based on the user's IVs.

moves.name: Hidden Power Water
moves.description: Type is based on the user's IVs.

moves.name: Ice Punch
moves.description: 10% chance to freeze the target.

moves.name: Knock Off
moves.description: Power is boosted 1.5x if user is holding a removable item. Removes the target's item.

moves.name: Leer
moves.description: Lowers target's Defense by 1 stage.

moves.name: Low Kick
moves.description: Deals damage based on the foe's weight.

moves.name: Low Sweep
moves.description: Lowers target's Speed by 1 stage.

moves.name: Pain Split
moves.description: Averages both Pokemon's HP.

moves.name: Payback
moves.description: Base Power doubles if the foe has taken its turn.

moves.name: Poison Jab
moves.description: 30% chance to poison.

moves.name: Power-Up Punch
moves.description: Hitting a target raises the Attack stat.

moves.name: Protect
moves.description: Prevents anything from working on the user that turn.

moves.name: Rain Dance
moves.description: Summons rain for 5 turns.

moves.name: Rest
moves.description: The user goes to sleep for two turns and restores all HP.

moves.name: Retaliate
moves.description: Power doubles if the user's teammate fainted the previous turn.

moves.name: Return
moves.description: No additional effect.

moves.name: Revenge
moves.description: Doubles in power if damaged.

moves.name: Reversal
moves.description: Does more damage as HP decreases.

moves.name: Rock Slide
moves.description: 30% chance to flinch.

moves.name: Rock Smash
moves.description: 50% chance to lower Defense by 1 stage.

moves.name: Rock Tomb
moves.description: Lowers Speed by 1 stage.

moves.name: Round
moves.description: Power doubles if a teammate uses Round in the same turn.

moves.name: Seismic Toss
moves.description: Does damage equal to the user's level.

moves.name: Sleep Talk
moves.description: Picks one of the user's moves at random. Can only be used while sleeping.

moves.name: Snore
moves.description: Can only be used while sleeping. 30% chance to flinch.

moves.name: Stone Edge
moves.description: Has a high critical hit rate.

moves.name: Storm Throw
moves.description: Always results in a critical hit.

moves.name: Strength
moves.description: No additional effect.

moves.name: Substitute
moves.description: Takes 1/4 the user's max HP to create a Substitute that takes damage for the user.

moves.name: Sunny Day
moves.description: Summons sun for 5 turns.

moves.name: Superpower
moves.description: Lowers the user's Attack and Defense by 1 stage.

moves.name: Swagger
moves.description: Confuses the target. Boosts its Attack by 2 stages.

moves.name: Taunt
moves.description: Forces the foe to use damaging moves for 2 turns.

moves.name: Thunder Punch
moves.description: 10% chance to paralyze.

moves.name: Toxic
moves.description: Inflicts intensifying poison on the target.

moves.name: Vital Throw
moves.description: Moves second, but ignores accuracy modifiers.

moves.name: Wide Guard
moves.description: Protects user and allies from multi-target attacks.

moves.name: Work Up
moves.description: Boosts user's Attack and Special Attack by 1 stage.

abilities.name: Guts
abilities.description: Attack is increased 50% when afflicted by a non-volatile status.

abilities.name: Mold Breaker
abilities.description: Abilities that hinder attacks are nullified.
